drupalNodeEvent.title: 大学沙龙｜产业资本，金融资本和科技资本

field_speakers.processed: 朱嘉明,刘永谋(中国人民大学),段永朝

field_description.processed: For more than three centuries since the Industrial Revolution, European and North American countries have gone from industrial capitalism to financial capitalism, and then entered the evolution to science-and-technological capitalism. The mainstream of traditional economics mainly discusses the material production and industrial structure of human society, as well as the industrial capital behind it; the IT revolution, together with the intelligent economy and the digital economy from the 1970s demands that economics explore and analyze the structure and mechanism of science-and-technological capital. The lecture focuses on comparing the commonalties and differences of industrial capital, financial capital and science-and-technological capital, and strives to explain how the modus operandi of science-and-technological capitalism dominates and affects the economic transformation of developed countries, and profoundly changes the fundamental structure of globalisation into the 2020s.
